title: (x) 1800s Victorian poster set - Brothers, Showcard Modern {Jan E, Mark S}
content:
Hello!

This is a very nice set of I believe cca 1800s poster types.  
I have identified most condensed ones as Hoefler Knockout variations, some Poplar, Ziggurat I believe, Bodoni poster etc.

I have circled the ones I still can't figure out - the image is small I know.  
If you have any ideas please share.

p.s. - the photo I believe is from an advert for entr'acte music label...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019152228im_/http:/typophile.com/files/victoriana_5952.jpg)
author: cicifoo

comments.content:
–  
THE is Brothers from Emigre.  
–

[http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=83](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019152228/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=83 "http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=83")

... as is FRESH FOREIGN FEATURES.
LOOK OUT! ONLY SHOW is close to Souvenir.

Thought of Souvenir. Uppercase K doesn't fit...  
Thanks for emigre one!

ELECTRIC LIGHTS is very hard to see, but maybe a couple of obliqued Hoefler [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019152228/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100013) weights? Could probably be many sans faces, but the G and R would be keys to see better. Nice one Mark, you beat me to it.

- Mike Yanega
